news.title: Shapoorji Pallonji Real Estate enters plotted development
news.para: Shapoorji Pallonji Real Estate has entered plotted development. They launched Treetopia, a 105-acre project in Pune. The project has a revenue potential of ₹600 crore. It will offer 483 residential plots.

news.title: Lucknow development body waives backdate maintenance fee on vacant flats in old schemes
news.para: Homebuyers in Lucknow have received a significant reprieve as the Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) has waived three years of backdated maintenance charges for new purchasers of vacant flats in older housing schemes. This decision, approved by the LDA Board, aims to boost sales by removing a substantial financial burden, making the purchase of unsold inventory more attractive for prospective buyers.

news.title: South Mumbai businessman claims scam in 'Aafiyah Heights' project; FIR against two
news.para: Byculla police have registered an FIR against two directors of Aafiyah Realtors for allegedly cheating a businessman of Rs 5 crore. The couple allegedly sold flats in a proposed high-rise project, "Aafiyah Heights," promising possession within 30 months. However, no flats were handed over, and the company was not registered at the time of the transactions.

news.title: Mumbai: Worli residents protest SRA move to terminate developer and warn of agitation
news.para: Worli residents are protesting the Slum Rehabilitation Authority's (SRA) move to terminate a developer, potentially jeopardizing 2,500 families. Residents threaten to boycott BMC elections if the decision stands. SRA officials cite project delays and lack of progress, while residents and their lawyer claim the developer is capable and supported, accusing the SRA of creating obstacles.

news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority lags in GPS tagging of properties
news.para: Bengaluru's ambitious GPS tagging of properties within the Greater Bengaluru Authority is significantly behind schedule, with only 28% coverage achieved.  Despite training workshops for revenue officials, concerns linger over data accuracy from both staff and property owners.  Authorities aim to tag all 25 lakh recorded properties to improve the system.

news.title: Lucknow: Deputy registrar cancels registration of RWA
news.para: The registration of Celebrity Green F & G Resident Welfare Association in Lucknow has been cancelled due to serious violations of the UP Apartment Act, 2010. The association was formed without a mandatory Completion Certificate and engaged in unauthorized financial collections and misuse of common areas.

news.title: Bombay HC sets up panel to resolve dispute over Koliwada land in Khar Danda
news.para: The Bombay High Court has formed a three-member committee to resolve a land dispute in Khar West, Mumbai, involving a slum rehabilitation scheme and the Koli community's traditional fish drying rights. The committee will hear both parties, conduct a fresh demarcation, and pass orders considering the rights of all involved.

news.title: Haryana set to allot residential plots to 7,000 landless families
news.para: Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini announced significant welfare reforms, including allotting 100-sq-yard plots to 7,000 landless families and linking them with the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. He also promised new government recruitment notifications and highlighted initiatives like free dialysis and subsidized LPG cylinders for women.

news.title: Mysuru urban local bodies record surge in property tax collection
news.para: Mysuru district's urban local bodies, including MCC, have seen a significant rise in property tax collection this fiscal year. Digital payment options, early payment rebates, and door-to-door drives have boosted compliance. MCC achieved 83% collection by October and aims for 100% by March 2026, surpassing last year's performance.

news.title: JM AMC expands presence in AIFs, launches ₹1,000-crore real estate fund
news.para: JM Financial Asset Management is unveiling Rs 1,000 crore fund targeting early-stage real estate ventures. This fund is strategically designed to offer debt capital that will assist developers in overcoming challenges associated with land acquisition and obtaining necessary approvals.

news.title: Government departments & bodies owe BMC over ₹3,000 crore in property tax dues: RTI
news.para: Government departments and public authorities owe the BMC over Rs 3,000 crore in property tax dues, with only Rs 243 crore recovered in the last five years. Despite demand notices and follow-ups, agencies like Mhada and Indian Railways remain defaulters, potentially burdening honest taxpayers.

news.title: About 21% of builders yet to file annual report on Gujarat RERA site
news.para: Despite extensions, only 79% of developers submitted their 2024-25 financial reports to GujRERA by the extended deadline. The authority is now imposing daily penalties and may freeze bank accounts for non-compliance, having previously offered a Voluntary Compliance Scheme to encourage submissions.

news.title: Mumbai: Redevelopment creeping in, yet Dadar Parsi Colony has retained its charm
news.para: Dadar Parsi Colony, once a vision of open spaces, is now experiencing redevelopment with high-rise towers replacing older buildings. Despite this, the enclave retains its charm due to Parsi covenant properties, restricting ownership and sales. Efforts are underway to archive its history and seek UNESCO accreditation, balancing modernization with heritage preservation.

news.title: Delhi civic body slaps fines worth ₹33.95 lakh on construction sites for GRAP-IV violations
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi is taking a strong stance against air pollution by imposing fines totaling more than Rs 33 lakh on construction sites that have flouted air quality regulations. During the implementation of GRAP-IV, all construction and demolition activities are halted.

news.title: Rainwater harvesting norms for homes eased in Punjab, composting must
news.para: Punjab's new building rules significantly ease rainwater harvesting requirements for residential properties, raising the threshold to 250 sqm. However, commercial and industrial sectors maintain a 100 sqm limit to address water depletion.  Additionally, on-site composting of organic waste is now mandatory for all plots of 500 sqm and above, promoting a 'Zero Waste' vision.

news.title: Delhi minister warns of strict action against  construction ban violations
news.para: Delhi's air quality crisis has prompted Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa to take decisive action against industries that pollute and violators of construction regulations. As GRAP 4 restrictions kick in, private vehicles failing to meet the BS-VI benchmark are barred from city entry, and the 'No PUC, No Fuel' mandate is rigorously enforced.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body to allow RMC plants within one km of construction sites
news.para: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has amended its policy on ready-mixed cement (RMC) plants, now permitting them within a one-kilometer radius of construction sites up to 7,500 sq metres. This change follows objections from builder associations concerned about the feasibility of onsite plants on smaller plots. The revised draft will be presented for standing committee approval.

news.title: Crackdown on seven illegal buildings in Ludhiana
news.para: Ludhiana Municipal Corporation's building branch demolished and sealed seven illegal structures across the city on Friday, acting on orders from MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal. The crackdown targets properties built without sanctioned plans or in violation of zoning regulations, with further action planned to deter unapproved construction.
